com.amazon.ags.api.whispersync.model
Interface SyncableStringList

public interface SyncableStringList

A syncable type that represents a list of strings. The list has a configurable max size, and is typically used to represent a list of latest strings. An example is a list of names of the last levels a player has played. Note that metadata cannot be associated with this type, but metadata can be associated with its elements.

See Also:
SyncableStringElement

Method Detail

setMaxSize

void setMaxSize(int size)
Sets the max size of this SyncableStringList. size must be positive and no greater than MAX_SIZE_LIMIT. If size is smaller than the current size of this SyncableStringList in the cloud, then its size will remain. In other words, the size of SyncableStringList can never shrink.

Parameters:
size - the max size of this SyncableStringList
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if size is non-positive or greater than MAX_SIZE_LIMIT.

getMaxSize

int getMaxSize()
Returns the max size of this SyncableStringList

Returns:
the max size of this SyncableStringList

Parameters:
value - The value to be added to this SyncableStringList.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if value is null or empty.

add

void add(java.lang.String value,
         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata)
Adds a SyncableStringElement to this SyncableStringList with the given string value.

Parameters:
value - The value to be added to this SyncableStringList.
metadata - the metadata associated with the SyncableStringElement to be created. Metadata can be null.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if value is null or empty.
See Also:
SyncableStringElement

isSet

boolean isSet()
Returns whether or not this SyncableStringList has been set in the GameDataMap. A SyncableStringList has not been set, if and only if it is empty.

Returns:
whether or not this SyncableStringList has been set in the GameDataMap.

getValues

SyncableStringElement[] getValues()
Returns an immutable copy of the elements of this SyncableStringList as an array. The size of the array is the lesser of its maxSize value and the total number of values added to the list.

Returns:
an array containing up to maxSize number of elements in this SyncableStringList.
